started.definition: This refers to loans that have a non-null Start Date
started.description: In order for a loan to exist, and thus have a start date, it must have been setup in the Encompass Loan Origination system

application.definition: An application is any loan with a non-null Application Date
application.description: Importantly, applications are not the same as leads. Applications occur much further along in the sales process, specifically when the borrower has filled out and submitted a formal mortgage application

preapproval.definition: A preapproved loan is one that has completed one of our preapproval funnels (such as our apply page) and has been sent a preapproval letter
preapproval.description: Preapproval letters are generally sent after the user completes one of our preliminary qualification steps. It contains info such as how much money the borrower is approved for

closed.definition: Closed loans are loans with a non-null Closing Date
closed.description: Closing time is ultimately when the company receives revenue for the loan. Most people will care about this group
